alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 3:44PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM AKST WEDNESDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Along the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 9 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibilities to as low as one half mile. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of light snow and gusty winds may develop across portions of the coastline prior to the advisory start time. However, the onset of light snow and wind is not expected to significantly reduce visibility to advisory levels. The peak of the event is expected between 9 AM to 9 PM Wednesday when the precipitation will be the steadiest and heaviest. Snow is expected throughout the entire Kuskokwim Delta with the worst conditions along the coast.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
